Here's a workaround. I think the problem is that pytorch hasn't initialized CUDA yet. At any rate, the following works for me:

import torch
x = torch.randn(1) # initialize cuda
torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor")

body:
Here's a workaround. I think the problem is that pytorch hasn't initialized CUDA yet. At any rate, the following works for me:
```
import torch
x = torch.randn(1) # initialize cuda
torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor")
```
